sentence.Network_en: There are intangible benefits beyond a rise in the share price.
sentence.Network_cn: 除股价上升之外还有无形利益。

sentence.Network_en: Now look yonder, just beyond the wooden post there.
sentence.Network_cn: 看那边，就在木头柱子的旁边。

sentence.Network_en: Few jockeys continue race-riding beyond the age of 40.
sentence.Network_cn: 很少有职业赛马骑师超过40岁仍继续参加赛马的。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  begeondan, from be 'by' + geondan of Germanic origin (related to yonand yonder)

encyclopedia.content: Beyond是一支来自于中国香港的著名摇滚乐队，也是华人地区的殿堂级乐队之一，成立于1983年，其队名的中文意思为“超越”。乐队属于原创型，其作品以写实为主。乐队曾经有过多次的人事变动，其中以黄家驹、黄家强、黄贯中、...

entry.def: If something is beyond a place or barrier, it is on the other side of it.

example.ex: They heard footsteps in the main room, beyond a door...
example.tran: 他们听见门外的大厅里有脚步声。

example.ex: On his right was a thriving vegetable garden and beyond it a small orchard of apple trees.
example.tran: 他右边是一个生机勃勃的菜园，菜园的另一边是一个小小的苹果园。

entry.tran: 超过，迟于（某个时间）；逾（期）
entry.def: If something happens beyond a particular time or date, it continues after that time or date has passed.

example.ex: Few jockeys continue race-riding beyond the age of 40...
example.tran: 很少有职业赛马骑师超过40岁仍继续参加赛马的。

example.ex: You may be entitled to Child Benefit if a child continues getting full-time education beyond the date already notified by you.
example.tran: 如果小孩接受全日制教育的时间超过了您已告知我们的那个期限，您就有权申请儿童补助金。

entry.def: If something extends beyond a particular thing, it affects or includes other things.

example.ex: His interests extended beyond the fine arts to international politics and philosophy.
example.tran: 他兴趣广泛，涵盖了从美术到国际政治乃至哲学的各个领域。

entry.def: You use beyond to introduce an exception to what you are saying.

example.ex: He appears to have almost no personal staff, beyond a secretary who can't make coffee...
example.tran: 除了一个不会冲咖啡的秘书之外，他好像几乎没有什么随身的工作人员。

example.ex: I knew nothing beyond a few random facts.
example.tran: 除了一些零星的情况外，我什么也不知道。

entry.tran: 超出，超过（某个点或阶段）
entry.def: If something goes beyond a particular point or stage, it progresses or increases so that it passes that point or stage.

example.ex: Their five-year relationship was strained beyond breaking point...
example.tran: 他们五年的关系已经紧张到无法维系。

example.ex: It seems to me he's  beyond caring about what anybody does.
example.tran: 在我看来，他不关心别人做什么。

entry.def: If something is, for example, beyond understanding or beyond belief, it is so extreme in some way that it cannot be understood or believed.

example.ex: What Jock had done was beyond my comprehension...
example.tran: 我无法理解乔克的所作所为。

example.ex: Sweden is lovely in summer — cold beyond belief in winter...
example.tran: 瑞典的夏天非常宜人——冬天却冷得让人难以置信。

entry.tran: 非…能力所及；超出…的能力
entry.def: If you say that something is beyond someone, you mean that they cannot deal with it.

example.ex: Although he could give her sympathy, any practical help would almost certainly be beyond him...
example.tran: 虽然他可以对她表示同情，但是他几乎根本无法提供任何实际的帮助。

example.ex: The situation was beyond her control.

means.word_mean: 1. farther along in space or time or degree;

sentences.sentence: "to the eighth grade but not beyond"
"will be influential in the 1990s and beyond"

means.word_mean: 2. on the farther side from the observer;

sentences.sentence: "agreed to provide essentials but nothing beyond"

auth_sentence.content: Should have application well beyond the world of sport.
auth_sentence.res_content: Should have application well beyond the world of sport.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Should have application well beyond the world of sport.

auth_sentence.content: But Hamilton's job has extended far beyond that.
auth_sentence.res_content: But Hamilton's job has extended far beyond that.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But Hamilton's job has extended far beyond that.

auth_sentence.content: It's gone well beyond what it should be.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's gone well beyond what it should be.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's gone well beyond what it should be.

Sentence.sentence: But they have a powerful hold on many people nonetheless, a hold extending far beyond their literary content.
Someone willing to work beyond regular hours.
Who wants to be told that there are limitations to what you can achieve based on something that is beyond your control, such as your genes?

More than paradise lost, a perishing rain forest could trigger a domino effect - sending winds and rains kilometers off course and loading the skies with even greater levels of greenhouse gases - that will be felt far beyond the Amazon basin.
They say that if Monsanto wins, the impact will extend far beyond agriculture―locking up property rights in an array of important areas.
In our times, human shrewdness has mastered the deep mysteries of the earth at a level far beyond the capacities of earlier peoples.

means.word_mean: (表示位置)在或往…另一边; 在或往…那一边; 在或往…的更远处

sentences.en: The house is beyond the bridge.

means.word_mean: (表示时间)迟于, 晚于; 在…之后

sentences.en: The new law extends this ban beyond 2002.
sentences.cn: 新法令将此项禁令延期到2002年以后。

sentences.en: They had no money beyond his salary.
sentences.cn: 除了他的薪水, 他们一无所有。

means.word_mean: (表示结果)不容; 超然于…之上

sentences.en: His conduct has been beyond reproach.

means.word_mean: (表示程度)超出…的范围; 超过; 对…来说太难

sentences.en: The switch on the wall was beyond the baby's reach.
sentences.cn: 墙上的开关小孩子是够不到的。

sentences.en: It's beyond me why she married him.
sentences.cn: 我无法理解她为什么嫁给他。

sentences.en: There weren't beyond twenty people present.

means.word_mean: 在更远处, 往更远处, 再往后， 在另一边；在（或向）更远处；以远

sentences.en: The immediate future is clear, but it's hard to tell what lies beyond.
sentences.cn: 近期内的情况很清楚, 但很难说以后如何。

sentences.en: We must look beyond for signs of change.
sentences.cn: 我们应该把目光放远, 看到变化的迹象。

sentences.en: Snowdon and the mountains beyond were covered in snow.
sentences.cn: 斯诺顿和远处的山到处都是白雪皑皑。

jushi.english: The tasks they faced seemed far beyond their ability.
jushi.chinese: 他们面临的任务似乎远远超出他们的能力。

jushi.english: It's beyond me why she married him.
jushi.chinese: 我无法理解她为什么嫁给他。
